intro: Tetracera fagifolia var. borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean tetracera, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with elongated, lanceolate leaflets. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments within lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
